intro: Erucastrum inodorum, commonly known as the sweet rocket, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant produces showy clusters of purple or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly peppery taste. Erucastrum inodorum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
